title: Can I pay a bankruptcy lawyer with a credit card I intend to get discharged?
question: If I'm going to file for bankruptcy, can I pay an attorney with a credit card that I don't intend on repaying?
answers: If you reaffirm the debt and pay the credit card you could pay your attorney but you will not find an attorney willing to do it that way.

If you were to pay a bankruptcy attorney with a credit card that you did not intend to pay, that would be bankruptcy fraud. You could be criminally prosecuted. You could be forced to repay the credit card. Your attorney could be subject to severe penalties as well.

I do not know any bankruptcy attorney who will accept credit card payments for bankruptcy services.
Not only is the answer no, as stated above, I don't know any bankruptcy lawyer who would accept payment by credit card.
It is bankruptcy fraud. You could be prosecuted and the lawyer who accepts the payment would be sanctioned by the court and may lose his privilege to practice in bankruptcy court.
No you can not pay an attorney with a credit card before you file for bankruptcy protection.
